channel.title: Sports
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: New York City Marathon: Mary Keitany Makes Her Move
item.description: Kenyans Stanley Biwott and Mary Keitany look to defend their marathon titles. Stay here for live updates, images and analysis.
item.author: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: LeBron James Passes Hakeem Olajuwon for 10th in Career N.B.A. Points
item.description: James finished with 25 points, 14 assists and 8 rebounds as the Cavaliers held off the winless 76ers, 102-101.

item.title: Nebraska’s Tommy Armstrong Jr. Carted Off After Hitting Head
item.description: Armstrong, who slammed his head on the turf while being tackled by an Ohio State player, was evaluated at a hospital before returning to the stadium.
item.author: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Fourth-Quarter Score Helps Alabama Escape Louisiana State
item.description: Crimson Tide quarterback Jalen Hurts scored on a 21-yard run early in the fourth quarter, and top-ranked Alabama’s defense shut down Tigers running back Leonard Fournette.
item.author: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Breeders’ Cup: Arrogate’s Win Ends California Chrome’s Perfect Year
item.description: Chrome, widely regarded as the best horse in the world, finished a close second in the Breeders’ Cup Classic, losing his first race in seven starts this year.
item.author: By JOE DRAPE

item.title: Versatile Penn State Offense Overwhelms Iowa
item.description: Saquon Barkley accounted for 211 all-purpose yards for the Nittany Lions, who scored on seven of 11 possessions and kept the pressure on.
item.author: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: In the Cubs’ New Kingdom, Bliss and Wonder Reign at Every Level
item.description: Five central characters in the team’s title chase reflect on their experiences during the dramatic postseason.
item.author: By BILL PENNINGTON

item.title: The Curse Needs a New Home. Snow or Surf?
item.description: With the Cubs ending their 108-year title drought this past week, the Curse needs to reside somewhere else, and Buffalo and San Diego top the list.
item.author: By FILIP BONDY

item.title: Yoenis Cespedes Opts Out of Mets Deal, Ringing Opening Bell of Free Agency
item.description: Cespedes, who hit .280 with 31 homers last season, opted out of the last two years of his contract and may attract offers worth $100 million or more.
item.author: By JAMES WAGNER

item.title: Andy Murray Supplants Novak Djokovic as No. 1 After Milos Raonic’s Injury
item.description: Murray advanced to the Paris Masters final without playing a single point when Raonic withdrew on Saturday because of an injury to his right leg.
item.author: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
